intro: Halogeton oppositiflorus, commonly known as the desert saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in saline soils and is adapted to extreme drought conditions. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in dense clusters, and its leaves are often reduced to scale-like structures. Halogeton oppositiflorus is notable for its ability to store water in its fleshy stems, which helps it survive in harsh desert environments. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
